title: Lopez will check in as CEO of Extended Stay America
text:
Lopez will check in as CEO of Extended Stay America Jul 21, 2015, 5:03pm CDT Share Austin Alonzo Reporter Kansas City Business Journal Austin Alonzo Reporter Kansas City Business Journal Home of the Day Mike Mozart | Flickr CC-licensed: https://flic.kr/p/oYvSBt Charlotte-based Extended Stay America Inc. (NYSE:STAY) is the largest operator of… more Gerry Lopez 's new opportunity is at Extended Stay America Inc. On Tuesday afternoon, the Charlotte, N.C.-based hotel chain operator announced Lopez — who will resign from his current post as CEO of Leawood-based AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc. on Aug. 7 — will become the next CEO of both Extended Stay America (NYSE: STAY) and its real estate investment trust ESH Hospitality Inc. In a statement, Lopez said he thinks the task will be similar to the one he carried out at AMC and he's excited to move to a new challenge. "Strategically transforming companies and brands is what I love to do. And we do it by building teams, focusing on the guest experience, innovating, redefining the business model and finding growth," Lopez said in a statement. "There are a lot of parallels between my prior position and the one at Extended Stay America, and I am thrilled to lead an organization with so much potential." POWER 100 PROFILE: Gerry Lopez Doug Geoga , chairman of Extended Stay America's board of directors, said Lopez has a proven track record of delivering outstanding consumer experiences and exceptional results to shareholders. On Tuesday, the Kansas City Business Journal took a look back at Lopez's time with AMC Entertainment .
